body: @gmaz @mpdreamz @mivano? Not sure how much of existing usage this would break (nor the implications - not an ES user myself) but it sounds like a nice ergonomic improvement...

The fields prefix is to support the logstash format in which additional properties are stored in the 'fields.' way. Changing this would be a breaking change as for example our kibana dashboard overviews are based on this structure.
I did see that @mpdreamz submitted some nice changes to the ES sink today (https://github.com/serilog/serilog/pull/289). Including a custom serializer so then you are free to format it to your liking.

I'd agree bumping whatever is in fields to the root of the object would be better but since it'll break existing dashboards and existing loggers this might need to be a boolean flag you can pass to `JsonFormatter` i.e: `bool omitPropertiesSubField = false`.

@Mpdreamz : Breaking existing dashboards - sure! But how loggers are affected? Anyway, I agree that it would be breaking change and therefore it must be "opt in". Your change #289 dramatically supersedes what I proposed here and I really like the direction it is heading. Can you include the option proposed above to your change? Same effect may be achieved by overloading JsonFormatter, but it is so much easier to use built-in JsonFormatter attribute.

issue.title: Elasticsearch sink improvements
issue.body:
This PR brings the default behaviour of the elasticsearch sink in sync with serilog's conservative choice to favor ToString()'ing unknown objects over desctructering them (such as exceptions).
- Sink now uses a subclass of `JsonFormatter`, instead of forcing the data into our own local LogEvent and relying on `ElasticSearchPropertyFormatter` to flatten serilogs data structures. We now hook into serilogs own serialization routine.
- Had to add some hooks so that the subclass could override property names.
- If you provide the elasticsearch sink with an `IElasticsearchSerializer` instead of ToString()-ing unknown objects the sink will serialize them as json objects allowing events to be filtered/aggregated more granular.
- This allows you to optionally take a dependency on `Elasticsearch.Net.JsonNET` and take advantage of the full power of JsonNET.
- Added unit tests for the elasticsearch sink.
- Added an .editorconfig file to force files to use an indentation of 4 spaces
- The events were always written to an index formatted DateTime.UtcNow, but the event timestamp should be leading what index the event has to go into.

issue.title: ElasticsearchSink: index name is calculated from local time, rather than UTC!

body: I think in light of the redesigned ES sink we can close this for now. Cheers!
Yes, new ES Sink directly addresses this problem. Closed indeed.
